title: French zoo closed temporarily after pack of nine wolves escape
description: No people were injured during the incident, but the wolf pack was killed due to safety concerns.

title: Welsh cook will spend Christmas aboard Boaty McBoatface
description: Steve Carpenter will cook Christmas dinner for climate scientists in the Antarctic

title: Green mankini, jacuzzis and a Harry Potter quiz - just a typical Christmas on tour with TMS
description: Test Match Special producer Adam Mountford shares some of his favourite Christmas Day and Boxing Day Test memories from his 20 years working in the team.

title: Premier League meeting 'a waste of time', says Spurs boss Conte
description: Tottenham boss Antonio Conte says Thursday's meeting between managers and the Premier League to discuss issues around the Covid-19 pandemic was like talking to a brick wall.

title: Covid: Glimmer of Christmas hope on Omicron, says Jenny Harries
description: But it is too early to downgrade the serious threat posed by the new variant, says Dr Jenny Harries.

title: Burnley-Everton called off because of Covid cases and injuries
description: The Premier League postpones Everton's match at Burnley on Sunday because of coronavirus cases and injuries.

title: Bangladesh ferry fire: Dozens killed near Jhalakathi
description: At least 37 people die and about 100 are injured after a ferry catches fire in southern Bangladesh.

title: Tesla disables gaming while driving feature
description: It follows an inquiry into Passenger Play, which allowed games to be played while a car was moving.

title: Chris Noth: Fourth woman accuses Sex and the City actor of assault
description: US singer Lisa Gentile alleges the Sex and the City actor groped her in a New York apartment in 2002.

title: Man killed by dog 'died doing what he loved'
description: Friends have paid tribute to "a hero in the dog world" after Adam Watts was attacked at his kennels in Angus.

title: Vunipola brothers sign new deals with Saracens
description: Billy and Mako Vunipola sign new contracts with Saracens, keeping alive their England prospects.

title: CrossCountry: Strike action affects Christmas Eve train journeys
description: Train operator CrossCountry says it has cancelled many services on Friday.

title: Selfridges sold for £4bn to Thai-Austrian alliance
description: The British luxury store chain is being bought by Thailand's Central Group and Signa Group of Austria.

title: Harbhajan Singh: India, Mumbai Indians and Chennai Super Kings spinner announces retirement
description: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh retires from all forms of cricket, making the announcement in a social media post.

title: James Franco accusers call him 'completely insensitive' after interview
description: Oscar-nominated actor James Franco recently admitted having sex with students at his drama school.

title: Woolworths 1920s Christmas nativity scene still going strong
description: The decoration has been part of a Norfolk family's Christmas for almost 100 years.

title: The woman keeping tabs on 150 reindeer
description: In the Scottish Highlands you’ll find a large herd of reindeer roaming the Cairngorms National Park.

title: 'Be brave and eradicate mistakes' - Root demands improvement in vital third Test
description: England have to be brave, show trust and eradicate "quite basic" mistakes in the third Ashes Test in Melbourne, says captain Joe Root.

title: Premier League festive predictions: Lawro v Tears for Fears' Manchester United fans Curt Smith and Roland Orzabal
description: Mark Lawrenson takes on Tears for Fears' Manchester United fans Curt Smith and Roland Orzabal to make predictions for the festive Premier League fixtures.

title: Sebbie Hall: Teenager's daily acts of kindness lead to foundation launch
description: Sebbie Hall originally set a goal of £1,000 and has now set up a foundation after raising much more.

title: Newspaper headlines: Omicron study hope, and Queen's moving tribute
description: The latest analysis on the severity of Omicron makes the front of several papers on Christmas Eve.

title: Rare pink handfish spotted in Australia for first time in decades
description: Australian researchers found the endangered "walking" handfish in wild waters off Tasmania.

title: Covid: Hyde Park Picture House archive details 1918-19 flu pandemic
description: Ledgers from a Leeds cinema reveal how the nation reacted to the Spanish flu after World War One.

title: What do giant veg growers eat on Christmas Day?
description: BBC News meets gardeners who use their gargantuan growing skills to help food banks and feed friends.

title: 'Christmas kindness means we can stay in the house'
description: A family has been overwhelmed by the public's reaction to the story of their financial struggles.

title: Omicron: Good news, bad news and what it all means
description: There are many things in our favour, but Omicron is spreading fast. What have we learned this week?

title: Switzerland's wolves get too close for comfort
description: Alpine villages say the animals have started approaching children and they need to fend them off.

title: Murray Head: 'Unsung at home, but a hero in France'
description: Murray Head is all but forgotten in the UK, but in his adopted home France he ranks among the greats.

title: Climate change: Small army of volunteers keeping deniers off Wikipedia
description: A group of editors is working tirelessly to keep bad climate info off the user-generated encyclopaedia.

title: Your pictures on the theme of 'sparkles'
description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

title: James Webb Space Telescope: How does it work?
description: The telescope has been 30 years in the making and is nearly ready to launch, but what makes it so special?

title: Georgia: The rise of the right
description: LGBT activists cancelled Tbilisi Pride this year after violence from far-right protesters.
